Module jGame
Package jGame.core.ui.hud

Class UIHudTextElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jGame.core.ui.hud.UIHudElement
      • jGame.core.ui.hud.UIHudTextElement
  • public class UIHudTextElement
extends UIHudElement
    This class represents a textual visual element whose only purpose is to display a piece of text to the screen.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nuno Pereira

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.awt.Color displayColor)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the color to render the text with.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.awt.Color displayColor, java.awt.Font displayFont)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the color of the text to be rendered.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.awt.Font displayFont)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.lang.String displayString)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the given starting text.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.lang.String displayString, java.awt.Color displayColor)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the given starting text.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.lang.String displayString, java.awt.Color displayColor, java.awt.Font displayFont)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the given starting text.
      UIHudTextElement​(int x, int y, java.lang.String displayString, java.awt.Font displayFont)
      Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the given starting text using the given font.

      • UIHudTextElement

        public UIHudTextElement​(int x,
                        int y,
                        java.lang.String displayString,
                        java.awt.Color displayColor,
                        java.awt.Font displayFont)
        Initializes this text element in the specified location and with the given starting text. Also specify the color used to render the text on the screen and the font of the text.
        Parameters:
        x - the horizontal position of this element
        y - the vertical position of this element
        displayString - the starting text to display
        displayColor - the color used to display the text
        displayFont - the font of the text to be displayed
        Since:
        1.0.0
